p: Aedes aegypti (L.) is the principal vector for many arboviral diseases, including dengue, chikungunya, yellow fever, and Zika ( 1– 4). They have (re-) emerged in many densely populated, tropical and sub-tropical areas around the globe, in part due to global trade and travel ( 5– 8). Almost half of the world's population is now at risk from these diseases ( 9).
